intro: Wulfenia carinthiaca, commonly known as the Carpathian wulfenia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while its flowers are small and yellow, forming dense clusters. Wulfenia carinthiaca is often found in meadows and slopes, contributing to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
